item.title: Array Problem
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

if(PlayerItemsW[i] = true)

assigns the value true to PlayerItemsW[i]

if(PlayerItemsW[i] == true)

checks if the value is true at PlayerItemsW[i]

item.title: Array Problem
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

This is always returning truee when it should be returning false, I think the array is going past or somthing along those lines,

if you place ‘System.out.println(PlayerItemsW [ i ] );’ before ‘if(PlayerItemsW [ i ] = true)’ or between the ‘if’ statements,
the println returns ’ false’ as it is in the code below it returns ‘true’ but… the real value is false ? =\

public void destroyUnstackedItemByID(int ID, int amount) { for (int i = 0; i < PlayerItems.length; i++) { if (PlayerItems[i] == ID) { if(PlayerItemsW[i] = true) { System.out.println(PlayerItemsW[i]); System.out.println("Slot: " + i + " was worn."); PlayerItemsW[i] = false; //removeItem(i); destroyItem(i); removeItemFromInv(i); return; } else { System.out.println("Slot: " + i + " wasn't worn."); return; } } } }
